results.title: Underground water
results.creator_credit: Roland Beckett, Australian Commonwealth Film Unit and Forum Australia
results.brief_description: The importance of underground water in Australia. Indicates the extent to which the cattle country relies on bore water and the work being done by geologists and hydrographers in the field, and the scientists in laboratories, on the problem of desalination.

results.title: Under western skies
results.brief_description: A survey of the dry farming and the irrigation farming practices carried out in the western states of USA furing the 1940’s. Criticism made towards farmers, ranchers and timber merchants for land abuse, soil degradation and water irrigation. Examples shown of conservation farming.

results.title: Under the radar
results.creator_credit: Evan Clarry, Chris Brown, Chris Fitchett, Macquarie Nine Film and Television Investment Fund and Pictures in Paradise
results.brief_description: Punctured with light-hearted comedic situations this thriller is part road movie, part gangster film. Adrian (Clayton Watson) who has severe amnesia and Trevor (Steady Eddy) who has cerebral palsy, are at a home for people with disabilities. When Brandon (Nathan Phillips), a local surf champion, turns up to do some Community Service as a result of a recent fracas, the three realise a road trip to the beach would break the monotony of daily life and provide some fun. Along the road they pick up the beautiful but mysterious hitchhiker Jo (Chloe Maxwell). The happy-go-lucky trip however takes a nasty turn as they stumble into a gang war and unwittingly find themselves in mortal danger. Cast includes Marg Downey.

results.title: Under one sky
results.brief_description: The veiled women of the Middle East have provided a constant source of fascination for Western culture over the years. The hijab (veil) has come to represent a number of conflicting issues, namely the oppression of Muslim women, the notion of the exotic “other”, and the tensions existing between Eastern and Western values. This insightful and thought-provoking documentary focuses on a group of women in North America who choose to wear the hijab for reasons relating to identity, religion and politics. Rebelling against the fragmented images of women presented through the Western media, these women reveal the complex ideologies behind the veil while simultaneously throwing down a challenge to those - both from the East and West - who would try to oppress them.

results.title: Under night streets
results.creator_credit: Ralph Keene, Edgar H. Anstey and British Transport Films
results.brief_description: A commentary on the people who work all night to keep London’s Underground on the move. Told with Cockney humour, it is the story of the care and thoroughness of night maintenance work.
